children.text: This template provides static numbers (account spending, account balance, etc.) in the abscence of an API. Connect your own custom APIs to simulate a 1:1 experience and collect real banking data from your customers.
The Banking Assistant Chatbot template uses
- which require the user to enter a specific piece of information in order to proceed.
This means that our chatbot will continue to ask the user (response utterance) for that information until it's provided.
Using images helps to visualize the conversation and
draws attention to important information, such as your account balance or spending history

Create no match options and custom buttoms to help guide the user towards a selection. Once the user matches an intent, it will re-direct the user to that specific intent (folder) and will begin following that respective path.
Need a starting point for your next chatbot?
The Banking Assistant Chatbot template is a great scalable design that can handle a diverse range of customer inquiries while directing the user to a series of answers.

These intents organize information and help navigate users to their desired requests: i.e. transferring money, spending history etc. It also provides support for FAQs or sub-functions including checking your account balance or asking for help.
you can click "R" on your keyboard to test the experience or jump right into the design to begin customizing the content!

If your experience has "custom actions" that you would like represented in your design – this tip is for you. This could be opening a car door or fetching credit card information - actions a developer could implement during the design hand-off.
is extremely useful as a type of placeholder event, as you can (1) simulate a variety of outcomes stemming from that action, and (2) provide the context needed for a smooth developer hand-off.
To learn more about this template , watch our video tutorial (link to follow)

- Make Transfer
- Check Spending
- Balance Inquiry
To account for the various ways a user might ask for a money transfer, it's important to enter a sizeable number of
- or bits of important information needed to fulfill the user's intent.
In this scenario, we have {3} entities:
1. To whom are we sending money
step to simulate an API request to the user's bank in order to retrieve their account info.

Users can invoke commands from anywhere in your experience. Commands are great for FAQ style questions. In the start block, we've created two FAQs: General Help & Account Balance. To learn more, enter the
Once the user triggers an intent, you can qualify their response with an
to filter the user down a specific path. In this scenario, a user can trigger one of two conversaton paths based on whether they provide a
Consider an IF Statement a cross in the road based on their answers.
Create intents based on the different banking options you want available to the user. In this experience, we've created two top-level intents:
Hello there! Welcome to Mobility Bank.
Hi there, and welcome to Mobility Bank.
What can I help you with today?
How can I help you today?
What can I do for you today?
Let me know how I can assist you today
Sounds good. I've cancelled your transfer.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Anything else I can help you with?
Would you like to see a list of the transactions?
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Anything else I can help you with?
Thank you for banking with us today. We hope to see you soon!
Anything else I can help you with?
Anything else I can help you with?
